About the Autosave feature
The Autosave feature guards against losing your work in case of a power failure by

spans.text: The Autosave feature guards against losing your work in case of a power failure by

lines.text: incrementally, and at regular intervals, saving file changes to a specified location. The original

spans.text: incrementally, and at regular intervals, saving file changes to a specified location. The original

lines.text: file is not modified. Instead, Acrobat creates an autosave file of changes, which includes all the

spans.text: file is not modified. Instead, Acrobat creates an autosave file of changes, which includes all the

lines.text: changes you made to the open file since the last automatic save. The amount of new

spans.text: changes you made to the open file since the last automatic save. The amount of new

lines.text: information that the autosave file contains depends on how frequently Acrobat saves the

spans.text: information that the autosave file contains depends on how frequently Acrobat saves the

lines.text: autosave file. If you set the autosave interval to 15 minutes, you could lose the last 14 minutes

spans.text: autosave file. If you set the autosave interval to 15 minutes, you could lose the last 14 minutes

lines.text: of your work if a problem occurs. Frequent automatic saving prevents loss of data, and is

spans.text: of your work if a problem occurs. Frequent automatic saving prevents loss of data, and is

lines.text: especially useful if you make extensive changes to a document, such as by adding comments.

spans.text: especially useful if you make extensive changes to a document, such as by adding comments.

lines.text: You can apply autosave changes to the original files when you restart Acrobat. When you

spans.text: You can apply autosave changes to the original files when you restart Acrobat. When you

lines.text: close, save manually, or revert to the last-saved version of a file, the autosave file is deleted.

spans.text: close, save manually, or revert to the last-saved version of a file, the autosave file is deleted.

lines.text: Note:
If you use assistive technology, such as a screen reader, you may want to disable the Autosave

spans.text: If you use assistive technology, such as a screen reader, you may want to disable the Autosave

lines.text: feature so that you don’t lose your place when the file is reloaded.

spans.text: feature so that you don’t lose your place when the file is reloaded.

lines.text: The Autosave feature won’t work in the following cases:

spans.text: The Autosave feature won’t work in the following cases:

lines.text: A document that has its security changed. You must save the document to re-enable

spans.text: A document that has its security changed. You must save the document to re-enable

lines.text: automatic saving of document changes.
A document created using the Web Capture feature or extracted from a larger PDF

lines.text: Recover lost changes
To prevent lost changes after an unexpected interruption, enable the Autosave feature, which

spans.text: To prevent lost changes after an unexpected interruption, enable the Autosave feature, which

lines.text: is the default setting.

File settings
Grayscale/Color: Specifies a compression setting that balances file size with image

spans.text: Specifies a compression setting that balances file size with image

lines.text: quality. The smaller the file, the lesser the image quality.

lines.text: Tile Size: Divides the image being compressed into tiles of the given size. (If the image

spans.text: Divides the image being compressed into tiles of the given size. (If the image

lines.text: height or width is not an even multiple of the tile size, partial tiles are used on the

spans.text: Determines how the file is displayed. Available only in JPEG format. It

Baseline (Standard): Displays the image when it has fully downloaded. This

spans.text: Displays the image when it has fully downloaded. This

lines.text: JPEG format is recognizable to most web browsers.

spans.text: JPEG format is recognizable to most web browsers.

Downloads the image first as a low-resolution

lines.text: Overview
Acrobat allows you to export images and text selections from a PDF to different file formats.

spans.text: Acrobat allows you to export images and text selections from a PDF to different file formats.

lines.text: Each format uses unique conversion settings when you export text or image selections.

spans.text: Each format uses unique conversion settings when you export text or image selections.
